title: The Seed Sowers
description: How do seeds disperse? In The Seed Sowers, students get an inside look at how seeds travel from one place to another with the help of animals such as elephants, beetles, birds, and bats. Interesting and engaging photographs help students see the many ways seeds can spread far and wide with the help of animals. The book can also be used to teach students how to identify the author's purpose as well as practice asking and answering questions about the text.
